## Alkanes

<div class="alcanos d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C">
  <img src="metano.png" alt="Metano" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Methane:</strong> used as fuel and raw material in the plastics and pharmaceutical industries.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC">
  <img src="etano.png" alt="Etano" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ethane:</strong> used as fuel and as an input in the production of ethylene and other chemical derivatives.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCC">
  <img src="propano.png" alt="Propano" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Propane:</strong> present in LPG (cooking gas) and automotive fuels.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCCC">
  <img src="butano.png" alt="Butano" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Butane:</strong> used as fuel in lighters and as a raw material in the production of synthetic rubbers.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC">
  <img src="hexadecano.png" alt="Hexadecano" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Hexadecane:</strong> also known as cetane. Used as a standard in studies on diesel fuels.
</p>

</div>

## Alkenes

<div class="alcenos d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C=C">
  <img src="etileno.png" alt="Etileno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ethylene:</strong> plant hormone that accelerates the ripening of fruits. It is also the basis for polymers such as polyethylene.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC=C">
  <img src="propileno.png" alt="Propileno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Propylene:</strong> used in cosmetics, perfumes, topical medications, and plastic production.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCCC=C">
  <img src="penteno.png" alt="Penteno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Pentene:</strong> used as a solvent, fuel additive, and in the production of industrial polymers.</p>

</div>


## Alkynes

<div class="alcinos d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=acetylene">
  <img src="Acetylene" alt="Acetileno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Acetileno:</strong> used in the manufacture of explosives, solvents, and plastics.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC#C">
  <img src="propino.png" alt="Propino" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Propylene:</strong> used in welding and chemical synthesis processes.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC#CC">
  <img src="2-butino.png" alt="2-butino" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>2-Butyne:</strong>  important intermediate in the production of synthetic rubber such as butadiene.</p>

</div>

## Alcohols

<div class="alcoois d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCO">
  <img src="etanol.png" alt="Etanol" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ethanol:</strong> used as a biofuel, solvent, and in alcoholic beverages.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C(CO)O">
  <img src="etilenoglicol.png" alt="Etilenoglicol" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ethylene glycol:</strong> used as an antifreeze and in the manufacture of polyesters.</p>

</div>

## Phenols

<div class="fenois d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C1=CC=C(C=C1)O">
  <img src="fenol.png" alt="Fenol" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Phenol:</strong> used in the production of resins, plastics, medicines, and disinfectants.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C1=CC(=CC=C1/C=C/C2=CC(=CC(=C2)O)O)O">
  <img src="resveratrol.png" alt="Resveratrol" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Resveratrol:</strong> an antioxidant found in grapes and wine. Studied for its potential to reduce LDL cholesterol.</p>

</div>

## Ethers

<div class="eteres d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CCOCC">
  <img src="eter etilico.png" alt="Éter etílico" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ethyl ether:</strong> used as a solvent and in anesthesia in the past. Also used in the manufacture of explosives and artificial silk.</p>

</div>

## Aldehydes

<div class="aldeidos d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC=O">
  <img src="acetaldeido.png" alt="Acetaldeído" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Acetaldehyde:</strong> compound used as an intermediate in the production of acetic acid and perfumes. Flammable and with a characteristic odor.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C=O">
  <img src="formaldeido.png" alt="Formaldeído" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Formaldehyde:</strong> toxic gas, widely used in the preservation of biological tissues and in the manufacture of disinfectants and resins.</p>

</div>

## Ketones

<div class="cetonas d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC(=O)C">
  <img src="acetona.png" alt="Acetona" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Acetone:</strong> organic solvent used in cleaning laboratory materials, in cosmetics, and in the synthesis of other substances.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C1CCC(=O)C1">
  <img src="ciclopentanona.png" alt="Ciclopentanona" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Cyclopentanone:</strong> compound with a mint-like odor. Used as an intermediate in the production of fragrances and chemicals.</p>

</div>

## Carboxylic acids

<div class="acidos d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC(=O)OC1=CC=CC=C1C(=O)O">
  <img src="ac.acetilsalicilico.png" alt="Ácido acetilsalicílico" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Acetylsalicylic acid:</strong> known as aspirin. Acts as an analgesic, antipyretic, and anti-inflammatory.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C([C@@H]([C@@H]1C(=C(C(=O)O1)O)O)O)O">
  <img src="acido ascorbico.png" alt="Ácido ascórbico" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ascorbic acid (vitamin C):</strong>  antioxidant that aids in iron absorption and strengthens the immune system.</p>

</div>
